mandaaapeaches: Hi! I am an administrative clerk in local government in Canada. Your page consistently helps me question what I've learned in my upbringing as a straight, cis, white, abled woman. It helps me sit with my discomfort and learn from why some of your posts make me uncomfortable. The emotional labour you put into this account is so appreciated - I hope to contribute to you financially when I am more stable in my finances in the future. Thank you for what you do, there is so much unpacking I need to do as a white person and you help me scratch the surface.
fierce_passions: Hey Ericka! Not new. I first read about you in an article featuring that iconic photo, then had the privilege to hear you speak at Sex Down South. I’m M’kali-Hashiki. Working for others: I teach med students how to do patient-centered pelvic & breast exams using my own body as the “demo model”. Working for myself: I have a private practice helping folx (primarily QTPOC) heal their erotic wounds so they can have the erotic & sexual life that is their Divine Birthright.
aaholmes07: You make my heart so happy, educated and stronger every time I see a post! My name is Ashley (she/her). My paid gig is a mental health clinician with children in VT. Thank you for allowing the opportunity for this communication and community 💚💚

thisismillie: Hi! My name is Millie and I’m a sex educator at a locally owned sexual wellness boutique. ☺️

loosey_flawlezz: Hey Ericka, you are incredible. Your mind and intelligence is so honest and real. I’m a queer social worker living in the most progressive city in Kentucky. jonbonjodie: Hiiiiii I'm Jodie (she/her). Been a long time follower/learner and am so very thankful for you and all you do. Professionally I am a medical oncology nurse (congrats on your 4 years 🙌) and in my non work time I ride motorcycles and tend to my 17 year old dog with dementia 😀
audrelordehavemercy: Hi Ericka, i am megan, a Black queer therapist in private practice. i prioritize seeing Black trans women on a sliding scale as well as run a therapy group for qtpoc. im a dancer and i just finished a certification in dance & movement therapy, hoping to integrate this into my practice to help our communities process daily traumas we hold in our bodies. grateful for you and your work.
sage_fem: Hi, I’m a big fan and so appreciate you, your work and your posts! I’m Sarah, (she/her/they) living on the coast of Maine with my wife missing city life. I was a Babeland customer in Seattle!! I’m a midwife but currently home full time with our baby! ❤️
brittany_nicole: I’m Brittany and I just wanna say that I admire you so much

iamthegoldenchile: Hi Ericka ❤️ (that was my late aunts name 🙏🏾) my name is Tiffanie (she/her) my paid work is a combat medic for the US Army and street photographer (I’ve had to put on hold due to my enlistment) My unpaid work is mom of 7 year old Kai and currently looking to engage myself in other things I love .
